     The developer should run the Fast Pass over the impacted control(s) and provide

Issues.Title: Implement Async Drag/Drop Workaround
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

This will track the work @JeremyKuhne is doing to create an opt-out for supporting Async Drag/Drop operations

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

N/A

### Issue description

N/A

### Steps to reproduce

N/A
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Implement Async Drag/Drop Workaround" (#13413)

Issues.Body:

Fixes #12991.
Fixes #12582.

Issues.Title: DarkMode (b) DarkModeButtonRenderer
Issues.Body:
Add a `DarkModeButton` Renderer based on our existing ButtonFlatRenderer.

This way, we are completely omitting the XP-VisualStyle rendering (and incomplete theming for 96DPI Buttons) by the theming and taking over ourselves.

Fixes #11949.

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13408)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "DarkMode (b) DarkModeButtonRenderer" (#13408)

Ensure that partial(for a single target) exclusions are shown in the solution explorer - moved item group that includes these items from build props to the specific project.

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Ensure that partial exclusions are shown in the solution explorer" (#13403)

Issues.Title: StatusStrip not themed dark when dark theme enabled in app.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

10.0.100-preview.5.25224.4

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Nope.

### Issue description

File Explorer's Status Strip:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/732f20d6-a66d-45ea-8b5c-2649caf58c78)
WinForms:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f04109e0-dbb4-4c72-8300-09bade5bd5b7)

I expected for it to be dark themed as well.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new winforms application.
2. Open Form1 in designer.
3. Add a StatusStrip to it.
4. Save the form and close it.
5. Go to Program.cs and set the color mode for the application to ``Dark``.
6. Notice that the status strip does not look dark at all compared to the one from ``explorer.exe`` (Windows Shell) when you open any folder when the system is set to ``Dark`` as well.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "StatusStrip not themed dark when dark theme enabled in app." (#13406)

Issues.Title: Cannot enter characters when adding ToolStripMenuItem1 and then adding ToolStripMenuItem2 after pressing enter in DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

main branch of WinForms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, this is a regression issue. Not repro on .NET 9.0 from Release/9.0 branch of WinForms repo.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/11a56acc-3a27-43d0-adeb-20824cb2bb96

### Issue description

**Actual result:**
Cannot enter characters when adding ToolStripMenuItem1 and then adding ToolStripMenuItem2 after pressing enter in DemoConsole application.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1e6fe900-449b-43bd-bfd1-e0c714f73a84

**Expected result:**
Characters can be entered when adding ToolStripMenuItem1 and then adding ToolStripMenuItem2 after pressing enter in DemoConsole application.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/42c4d5a2-b530-4d27-a466-7db5e687c202


### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) bases on main branch in Winforms repo.

More info:
1. This issue rerpo in ContextMenuStrip/MenuStrip/ToolStrip/BindingNavigator control in DemoConsole application.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Cannot enter characters when adding ToolStripMenuItem1 and then adding ToolStripMenuItem2 after pressing enter in DemoConsole application" (#13400)

Issues.Title: New project has already 1 error
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Version 17.13.5

Microsoft .NET Framework
Version 4.8.09032

AI-assisted development for Visual Studio.

### .NET version

.9.0.201

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

Yes.

### Issue description

When creating a new Windows Forms project, I always run into an error. I have not added any packages. This is the error call stack.

at Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.DesignToolsClientLoader.d__27.MoveNext() 


### Steps to reproduce

Create a new project?
